title: Marios Demetriou
text:
Marios Demetriou (; born 25 December 1990) is a Cypriot professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> who plays as a <a href="right%20back">right back</a> for <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a> club <a href="PAEEK">PAEEK</a>.
Club career.
Omonia Nicosia.
Demetriou joined Omonia's academies at age seven. He made his first first-team appearance on 24 November 2012 for the senior squad during the 2012–13 season in a home win 4–2 against <a href="AEP%20Paphos%20F.C.">AEP Paphos</a>, replacing <a href="Georgios%20Efrem">Georgios Efrem</a> in the 89th minute. 
On 8 July 2017, he signed a contract renewal until the summer of 2020.
Loan to Alki Larnaca.
In 2013–2014, Demetriou was given on loan to <a href="Alki%20Larnaca%20F.C.">Alki</a>.
Loan to Ermis Aradippou.
On 30 June 2018, Demetriou joined <a href="Ermis%20Aradippou">Ermis Aradippou</a> on loan until the end of the season.
Nea Salamina.
On 31 August 2019, Demetriou signed for one year contract until June 2020 with <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a> club <a href="Nea%20Salamis%20Famagusta%20FC">Nea Salamina</a>.
PAEEK.
On 21 July 2020, Demetriou signed for Cypriot club <a href="PAEEK">PAEEK</a> until June 2021. In August 2021, <a href="PAEEK">PAEEK</a> announced the renewal of his contract until 2022.
International career.
He made his debut for the <a href="Cyprus%20national%20football%20team">Cyprus national team</a> on 11 October 2021 in a <a href="2022%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%E2%80%93%20UEFA%20Group%20H">World Cup qualifier</a> against <a href="Malta%20national%20football%20team">Malta</a>.
Honours.
Club.
Omonia
PAEEK
